data.title: prompt to save before running unsaved scene
data.body: When you try to run the project or a local scene, instead of just popping up the message that the scene hasn't been saved before, it should just popup the save scene dialog, and then run after saving the scene. I'd say this should always happen, but at the very least if the autosave before running option is ticked.

data.title: Move Nodes multiple in tree hierarchy
data.body:
Currently it is possible to move only one node at a time in the tree hierarchy.
If you want to move lots of nodes this can take some time this way.

As discussed in the irc this seems to be a bug. Would be great to move more nodes at a time.

data.title: Node Duplication enhancement
data.body:
This  is a small request to provide a better usability for duplicating nodes within godot.

Right now when you duplicate a set of nodes they will always be placed at the end of the scene tree. This may give problems with drawing order and you the first thing I always did was to move the duplicated nodes up to the original node. This can take some time especially if you have lots nodes you are duplicating.

Recommended bahavior would be to place the duplicates directly below the node you wanted to duplicate and then select that node. This way you keep the order of the overall scene tree.

data.body: with godot is not in fullscreen mode the mouse point not is centered, but in with reized windows maximal the mouse go normal, this appen in the editor and in played game

and demos with it. they all look correct to me.
closes #959

data.title: looped animations give unexpected results
data.body:
If you loop an animation and use the continuous interpolation mode, after the last keyframe in a track, things get wonky. If you have a keyframe at the very end of the animation's length, the value will loop back to 0 immediately. If you have a keyframe earlier, it'll count down from that keyframe back to the first keyframe in the track.

I've never seen a loop behave like this before. I tested this in v0.99.3653-pre-beta from January 3rd, and get the same behavior, so this isn't a regression, by the look of it.

Here's a video showing how to reproduce this, in case it's not clear what I'm saying: http://youtu.be/Ti0OBfWR4a8

I can't see why anyone in their right mind would WANT this behavior to happen automatically, since they could simply keyframe back down at the end of the animation. But those of us who don't want this behavior don't have any option unless we want to insert keyframes for EVERY value... Which is simply making things far more tedious than need be. Even extending the animation a bit, inserting a duplicate keyframe there, then setting the length back to the desired value doesn't prevent this from happening (keyframe past length is just ignored, as would logically be expected).

List of children appear I can change value in inspector but when I play the scene value isn't change.

data.title: Saving Files under Windows. (.tmp)
data.body:
Hi there,
this is something that bothered me for a long time. This issue is as far as I know only windows related. At least I tested under windows and linux, but under linux it doesn't occur.

When saving files in godot, godot creates .tmp files of the original, and then deletes the old file and renames the tmp file to its original name. At least the procedure should run similar as described.
But it happens relatively often that you remain the tmp file and that file is not renamed back to its original name. 
This can result in a few bugs/issues. On the one hand resources cannot be loaded. You start your game with F5 and suddenly it abords the game because some resources cannot be found resulting in nil objects.
Suddenly missing script files. And I now even discovered that the Editor settings can be completely deleted. I always wondered why my project list sometimes got deleted and I needed to reset all android export settings under windows. I now looked into the godot folder under app data and discovered that this tmp issue caused the problem. This error got me really mad xD
So, this saving issue can happen everywhere where godot saves files.

I would call this bug critical for a release, because new users would never know what happens there. It took me a very long time to discover that you just have to rename the tmp files back to the original name and everything works. Especially for a 1.0 release this should work!

data.title: "Save Scene" while in script tab loses scene changes
data.body: If I make changes to my scene in the 2d editor, then change to the script tab, and make changes there, saving (either by ctrl-s or Scene->Save Scene) only saves the script changes.  The star in the window title goes away, indicating that there are no unsaved changes.  The menu item is even called "Save Scene", but it doesn't actually save the changes to the scene if you're not looking at the scene.

data.title: Allow us to set a default/template/skeleton project
data.body:
Every time I make a new project I have to go through the settings and change everything in there, then in the input map, etc. It would be nice to let us create a project template, then save it somewhere in ~/.godot/skeleton/ or something, and have that used as the defaults whenever we start a new project.

Bonus: let us edit the default GDScript template as well.

data.title: Full screen Godot projects cannot be captured by the "Print Screen" key.
data.body:
This has been found with Godot RC2 on a Win7 64 bit machine with an Ivy Bridge i7 CPU, an ATI HD 7xxx series GPU, and 16 gigs of RAM.

I'm wondering if this is intentional or not, the issue is that when you set your Godot scene to run at full screen, and you take a screenshot of it using the 'print screen' key, it won't actually get a shot of the actual game in play (instead it gets whatever you would get once you exit out).

This occurs in all cases that start up full screen play, windowed mode works in all cases (even in full size).

If this is fixable, that would be great and would help present projects to the community.

Thanks.

data.title: Add a scaling handle in the 3D editor
data.body: I think you need to add a scale handle before the final release.

data.title: Problems with other languages
data.body: All file paths must use English characters only, also applies to comments in the scripts. When using characters from other languages, errors occur. It would be good to use the default UTF-8 encoding, in order to avoid problems with other languages.

data.title: [request] show all built-in ressources of a scene into the Ressources tab when the scene is loaded
data.body:
Hi again !

When I load a scene into the editor, it would be cool if all the built-in ressources were automatically listed all at once into the Ressource tab.

data.title: FileSystem-Tab throw errors when trying to load scene in a sub-sub-directory
data.body:
Hi,

I'm using RC2 win64.

![filesystem_tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/5364826/0a8d023c-7fe7-11e4-893a-7d8150d9d24b.png)

If I try to load a scene stored in a sub-sub-directory, it does not work, and the console says : 

**ERROR: load_interactive:**  Condition ' err!=OK ' is true. returned: Ref<ResourceInteractiveLoader>()
**At:**  core/io/resource_format_binary.cpp:1006
**ERROR:**  Failed loading resource: res://hell.scn
**At:**  core/io/resource_loader.cpp:204
**ERROR: load_resource:**  Condition ' !res.is_valid() ' is true. returned: ERR_CANT_OPEN
**At:**  tools/editor/editor_node.cpp:348

loading "assets/generic_map.scn" works
loading "assets/map/hell.scn" does not work

Note that I'm still able to load it using the Scene/Open Scene menu.

data.title: allow preload of "self script" in script (with warning about circular reference)
data.body:
Suppose we have "MyScript.gd". Allow the following in "MyScript.gd":

``` GDScript
const MyName_For_MyScript = preload("MyScript.gd")
var MyInnerClass = MyName_For_MyScript.MyInnerClass
```

data.title: 3D mouse picking test demo broken ?
data.body:
Hi,

Godot RC1, win64.

I was studying the "3d mouse picking test" demo, and according to the mousepick.gd script, the material of the picked mesh should change IF mouse clicked. However, whatever mouse button I click, the **_input_event()** method is never called.

I tried to call a set_process_input(true) and a set_process_unhandled_input(true) into the _ready(), but it seems useless.

Is it a bug or is there some line missing into the demo script ?

data.title: Integrate javascript support as scripting language
data.body: As javascript is well known and really popular language it will be grate for godot to implement it as scripting language. As godot already supports C it can be done with help of this project http://duktape.org/
